org.araneaframework.backend.util
Class BeanMapper<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.backend.util.BeanMapper<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BeanMapper<T>
extends Object
implements Serializable

This class provides a way to manipulate Bean properties. This class assumes that the class passed to constructor ( BeanClass) implements the Bean pattern - that is to open it's properties using getters and setters (read-only properties are permitted). The only names permitted are those starting with "get", "is" and "set". Another requirement is that beans must have a constructor that doesn't take any parameters.

Author:
Rein Raudj√§rv (rein@araneaframework.org), Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
BeanUtil, Serialized Form

BeanMapper

public BeanMapper(T bean)
Initializes the mapper taking a value which is used to resolve target class. The class of the value is taken.

Parameters:
bean - The value to use for class resolving. The value must not be null.
Since:
2.0

BeanMapper

public BeanMapper(Class<T> beanClass,
                  boolean createMissingBeans)
Initializes the BeanMapper.

Parameters:
beanClass - the class implementing the Bean pattern.
createMissingBeans - Whether to create missing beans during writing bean sub-properties (default is false).
